column13: We dine out 3-4 times each month, and like to try new places. The restaurant ambiance was fabulous. Everyone was very pleasant and friendly as we arrived. Our server made a good first impression, but lost the charm thoughout our dining experience when we simply told her we would be splitting our 4-person bill into 2. I have trained people in the hospitality industry and she needs some work on her attitude. Anyway, we spoke to a manager as well, and she was not polite either; in fact, she was quite rude. I'm not sure if I'll go back to this restaurant, I certainly won't recommend it to anyone, including the guests at my hotel, and I'll be sure my concierge team doesn't recommend it either. I hope to have a better experience at Roast.

column4: Detroit Marriott at the Renaissance Center - Level 3 Level 3 Detroit, MI  48243
column13: Very unorganized for brunch. Food was a bit bland. Omelette maker was good. The advertising suggested a high floor level on 42 floor but was in 3 rd floor. Very disappointed.

column1: 5ive Restaurant at The Inn At St. Johns
column13: Just about what one would expect from hotel dining in a mid-sized property. High tables in bar area with televisions, through to a room with four tops and booths. Enough food choices to find something to satisfy. Place was empty when we were there. Salad was nothing special, and fish was cooked properly.
We really enjoyed the experience and the special attention from the students is what makes the experience great.
The experience was excellent except for one beverage that went un-refilled for half and hour.

I brought a client and wife to Novi on 10-27-12. Dining room was slow. Hostess sat us at a 4 table, I ask to sit at booth. She came back to say it wasn't avaliable and I had to insist on booth. Got a male waiter who took a while to warm up to us, but he did fine when we started spending money. I personally ordered the veal porterhouse rare and had to send it back because it came back medium, it took a while to come back. Because of time frame to get it, I took it home and ate it later that night. I would say it was not a $45 steak. It was not flavorful at all and had a lot of gristle. There is more issues too. Can I get a call please? 248-310-0463

column4: 400 Renaissance Center Suite A403 Detroit, MI  48243
column13: Restaurant had my reservation, but we did not get to sit as requested by the window, we sat by the waiter alley. Wine pour EXACTLY 5 OUNCES, house wine $10/glass...very average chardonnay. Chianti Classico, EXACTLY 5 OUNCES,good and $14/glass. Pasta prices reasonable ($20 Fettucine Alfredo) but light on the sauce. Whitefish looked good, guests liked it. Service was attentive and friendly. I got the feeling we were on a time limit for the table. I probably would not return. I did not pay the bill nor did I see the check, so I can't comment on total price. I sense that it was rather expensive overall.

We were greeted upon arrival and shown to our seat. We had asked for a high chair and one was provided quickly. Our server did an outstanding job. He was attentive without being over bearing. He appeared to know the menu and was helpful with our choices. The food (especially the crab cakes) was great. We were happy with our experience.

column4: 129 S. Main Street Royal Oak, MI  48067
column13: Food is predictable okay, but one goes for consistency versus innovative at Andiamo. Atmosphere and service is always excellent. Good wine served in exquisite glasses.

The experience was sort of marred from the start because the hostess was rude and condescending (not even sure why?). The dining area is very small with small tables pushed in very close together. We were at a tiny table in the middle of the room shoved between a big cactus looking thing and next tables wine cooler. the couple next to us was almost bumping enbows with us. On the good side the wait staff was very good and knowledgable, and the food was outstanding. Would've loved to come for the food again, but the ambiance is just not that enjoyable.

We enjoyed our entire dining experience.The staff was friendly and accomodating.The service and ambience is excellent, only to beoutdone by the fine, homemade, interestingupscale Mexican cuisine. The swordfish tacos andfresh guacamole were outstanding. Theyalso have an extensive selection of tequilas!We will definitely be back.
our teppanyaki experience was good. our chef was very accomplished in his craft. accomodated each diners request. and interacted with all of at our table.

This was my boyfriends first trip to Benihana. He really enjoyed hisself! We will be coming back very soon. One downside was that our chef was hard to understand and seemed a little flustered when he did not have all of the items on his cart, this took away from the overall experience.

column4: 1985 W. Big Beaver Road Troy, MI  48084
column13: Great food and wonderful show. Chefs are very talented. Lots of fun for a group.
Great for family dinners. Had a great time and the service was wonderful.
Our Waiter, Mitchell, is wonderful. He is personable, attentive, and does an overall fantastic job! That really makes our dining experience special!

column4: 302 S Main Street Ann Arbor, MI  48104
column13: Probably the most accomodating staff of any restaurant I have visited. I require wheelchair access and the floor manager with the wait staff were very obliging. Food was wonderful in presentation and taste.

column1: Brookshire Restaurant at the Royal Park Hotel
column13: Throughly enjoyed the evening. Food and service were good and would certainly return.
Great Food and ambiance! Always love to eat there!

This place is awesome. My BF and I went on a Saturday afternoon, and we got like a whole room to ourselves! The Waitress was amazing! She was super helpful because it was our first time, and we have no idea what to expect! The food. Omg. The food was amazing. It was a lot of food. I am glad we went for lunch, because there was a lot left over for later!!

column1: Cadillac Cafe at The Detroit Opera House
column13: The service was outstanding and prompt. They knew we had to have our dinner done in time to get to the ballet and they made sure we were done before curtain time. The food was very good, as always, but I would appreciate a little change in the menu. I love the wood floors and the ambiance of having a restaurant in the theater. We especially loved it when the waitress sang for the dining guests. Unfortunately, she hasn't sung every time we go, but we're hopeful we'll get to hear her sing again.

column4: 204 South Main Street Ann Arbor, MI  48104
column13: Limited menu but everything on it is excellent. Very good weekend brunch.

column4: 418 S. Washington Avenue Royal Oak, MI  48067
column13: Amazing dinner where all 7 of us were beyond impressed with the food. Great sommelier to help select a great wine. Our waitress was friendly and helpful as well!

Wanted to take my wife on a nice beautiful birthday Dinner. Thought I would be taking her to a fancy very good dinner. We walked in and was greeted nicely, then it took a long time for the server to get to us. My wife orderded a $10.00 glas of wine and I just wanted a water (I dont drink and dont need POP) so instantly he was irriatated with me. We ordered our steaks and yes my wife ordered hers Well Done and mine was supposed to be medium. we got the stakes and hers was medium and mine was medium well. I did not send mine back but she sent her back, well 15 minutes later a hockey crusted puck came back. The Augratin Potatoes were cubed potatoes with basically covered in velvetta cheese. We ate our dinner and paid our $130.00 and left.NEVER

column4: 2800 West Big Beaver Road Troy, MI  48084
column13: Always love to dine here!! If you want a quieter room request one of the back private rooms- so much better.
Good variety of menu items. We went after a UM football game and it was perfect for that. Convenient parking, takes reservations, casual but nice.

Great food and wonderful service! Crab cakes are very tasty, we had them twice! we also both had delicious meals. I tried the beef stroganoff and my fiance had the beef medallion/crab cake combo, with potato and fresh green beans. Meat was cooked perfectly~ too bad we were too full to try dessert, the table next to us ordered dessert and the selections looked very tempting. Pricing was fair for quality, quantity and overall service!

My wife and I went to the Chop House because we had a night out alone and always wanted to try it. The staff was very profesional and attentive. The food was outstanding and something you will not find at just any good restaurant.

Went for restaurant week. The food was just OK - portions were very small, and maybe I just didn't know what I was doing but the squab was impossible to eat! I don't know if it's supposed to be that tough, but I felt like an idiot tearing apart a greasy bird with my hands (no steak knife given) at a nice restaurant. Dessert was excellent, although they told us at first one was sold out then brought it to us anyway. Was someone hoarding it??Live jazz music so it's very noisy.The drinks are great, so I'll probably just stick with those next time and dine elsewhere.

Venerable and impressive with the best view of any reteraunt in Michigan and possibly anywhere in the Midwest. Signature dishes like the lobster corn dog are excellent but overall the food was more chain steakhouse than unique and inspiring. Go at least once for the sights and experience but could be better.

column4: 318 South Main Street Ann Arbor, MI  48103
column13: Great place to go before seeing a show at The Ark! No worries about being late for the show, things moved along, but never felt rushed. Was finished and completely satisfied within an hour of being seated.

We had an event at Craves for about 50+ people and the Manager Josh, made sure that everything was taken care of. I gave him my budget and he helped with the selection of the menu items. There was more than enough food for everyone and it all came out on time and hot. The staff was very friendly and a good time was had by all. We will certainly consider Crave for our next event.

A DISAPPOINTMENT !!!!!!The decor was lacking a lot..I could have done a better job...I thought I was taking my mother to a nice place..AWFUL..The food was something I could have made much better at home..It was LESS THAN AVERAGE..I think Chef needs to get it together.The service to start with was 4 different waiters asking if my mother and I wanted alcohol...I cannot drink !!! Or are we not welcome in this establishment if we are not drinking..That is whet it felt like..TERRIBLEA nice older waiter finally tended to our table thank you.I told my mom I was taking her to a wonderful restaurant... I was really shocked it was NOT great..My mom was kind and did not say much but her face said it all..

column1: D'Amato's Restaurant & Goodnite Gracie Martini Bar
column13: Had a wonderful evening at D'Amato's. The food was delicous, and great wine menu. The service was impeccable. One of our favorite places to dine out.Excellent everytime.

A good if not great restaurant. Had the hanger steak which was fine. Not sure if the concept of lesser meat cuts is enough for a distinctive menu, or a loyal following. Prices were reasonable, service was still rough around the edges. Decor more like Fridays or some other moderate chain. Will likely return, but won't rush back.
good service, big appetizers, nice spot. we'll go back.

Relaxed evening in a peaceful atmosphere. the wine list was great and the food was just as good. the atmosphere was unique given that it was in the basement of a building however the food is what is important and it was spot on. i would definitely recommend for a nice evening out with your spouse!
Very good overall experience at Fiamma's Grill. The food was excellent and service was attentive. This is a great place for a group event or special dinner.
below average food,fair service, not a place I would recommend or return to. We went before the World Series game are were one of two patron groups. Tells you something.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Birmingham MI
column4: 325 N Old Woodward Avenue Birmingham, MI  48009
column13: Good good and while I am willing to pay a higher price for the quality steaks and seafood they serve it seems that the a la carte sides are way overpriced as are the cocktails. Gotta give a diner a little break here!

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Livonia
column13: All of the "Johnny come latelies" into the steakhouse genre need to take a lesson from Fleming's. They've served some the best steaks that I've eaten in my life. The service is always top notch and if things are not perfect, they make it perfect. They're really hard to beat.

This restaurant is a favorite of mine because of the impeccable attention to details. The influence of Brian Polcyn, an acknowledged great chef, is evident as it should be, since he is owner. Claudia is among the three best sommeliers in this area and has the certifications, experience, and recognition to back that. The bartender is a steady pro who has been mixing and pouring for a very long time. This one is as close to San Francisco and New York as it gets in this part of Michigan!
What a unique and interesting location. We visited in between "fountain" and "ice rink" seasons -- would be wonderful to visit again for a glass of wine after ice skating!

A destination worth the price. Truly gourmet with a lovely presentation and the flavors were simply devine. The character of the old train station just adds to the experience. Service was excellent without being overbearing.
Real food done well! Great cocktails!
Always a fun and energetic palce to eat. Needs to add substance to some meal choices. Can be surprisinly bland if not careful with dinner selection.

column4: 6810 N. Rochester Rd. Rochester Hills, MI  48306
column13: Always a great evening when we go there. Friendly staff and owners make it feel like a community.
Exceptional service!! Pricey but perfect for a special occasion.

Our food was excellent and our waitress was very friendly but we waited waaaay too long for our food. Two tables that came in after us were served food before us. The wait between salad, dinner, and dessert was annoyingly long.

column4: 1978 Cass Lake Road Keego Harbor, MI  48322
column13: Service was excellent, food equal. Seasonal menu is outstanding; made it very difficult to decide. We were seated immediately and not rushed at all, which can happen at small places on busy nights. This is one of our favorite restaurants near to home, but it is very worth the drive if you don't live near!
The food was excellent! Thinking of making reservation over holidays.

column1: Joe Vicari's Andiamo Italian Steakhouse - Bloomfield
column13: The service was unremarkable! Staff were very attentive and knowledgeable with the entrees and wines. A little pricey, but worth it.

column1: Joe Vicari's Andiamo Italian Steakhouse - Dearborn
column13: Have been very disappointed with the change-over here. This is our second visit since the switch to a steakhouse, and I couldn't be more disappointed. We tried a second time because the first time wasn't good, and we were hoping it was just a fluke. The only good thing about the food was the cheesecake that we split for dessert. Unfortunately, we will not visit this location again. I would rather drive further to downtown Detroit and visit that Andiamo's than to visit the one down the street from me in Dearborn.

column1: Joe Vicari's Andiamo Italian Steakhouse - Warren
column13: Andiamo's has been a favorite in the past but with the new ala carte practice and rise in price I doubt that we will be back, $58.00 for what we had is way, way out of line. We didn't get the break basket until we asked, and $6.00 for a dinner salad is crazy, especially when we didn't know that it was an extra.
Nice place, nice people. worked with me even though my group was late. This will not be my only time going.

column4: 30 E Big Beaver Road Troy, MI  48083
column13: I always enjoy going to Kona Grill, however I am usually in the bar/patio area. I have been to Kona over 20 times at this point, and I think I have only been in the dining room 2 or 3 times, and I must say, it is quite nice, well laid out, and spacious. You can't beat the happy hour deals in the bar area, and the full menu itself has something for everyone.
Food and service were excellent. A little hard to find, but once you get there it's well worth it.

A welcome entry in the local Middle Eastern cuisine offering, this restaurant is well-done, with linens, gracious appointments and efficient service. The food was authentic and nicely plated. It is far more upscale than restaurants serving similar cuisine. Too bad it is hidden in such an unappealing location, with a Sam's Club and Home Depot in an off-road complex.

column4: 226 S. Main St Ann Arbor, MI  48104
column13: a couple of things:

column4: 115 W. Washington St. Ann Arbor, MI  48104
column13: Great on all fronts (food, service, special occasion recognition) The experience exceeded our expectations.

column4: 34911 Van Dyke Avenue Sterling Heights, MI  48312
column13: Menu was excellent. Beer samples were great.
Mac's is always good. We eat there regularly, mostly for lunch, sometimes for dinner. Food and service is first-rate. Selections change and specials are often wonderful.

column4: 2089 W. Big Beaver Road Troy, MI  48084
column13: Our waitress, LeAnn, and her supporting staff were wonderful. She did a great job of taking care of our party of 2 along with the party of 20+ next to us. Thank you for a great experience.

column4: 341 E. Liberty Ave Ann Arbor, MI  48104
column13: Great place but had to wait until 8:20 to be seated for an 8:00 reservation.

We had a great experience at McCormick and Schmick's. We had a party of 7 including a toddler and infant. We were given one of the snugs near the back, which provided us some privacy and worked great with the children. Veronica gave us outstanding service and even suggested bringing out our 2 year old's food before the rest so she wouldn't get antsy. The food was great. We got the calamari, our usual favorite, but also tried the coconut shrimp, which was excellent. The swordfish portions were ample and the mixed grill was a big hit. The restaurant is definitely worth trying if you haven't already.

column4: 2900 S. State St. Suite #7 Ann Arbor, MI  48104
column13: Chef Huey has done a fantastic job! Will definitely return.

column4: 312 S. Main Street Ann Arbor, MI  48104
column13: My wife and I came in for our anniversary and had an overall good experience. The food was great and the portions were generous. We especially liked that we were given an amuse-bouche. The lamb and the duck were cooked perfectly but everything seemed a little rushed, we hardly had time to breathe in between courses. We took advantage of the half off bottles of wine which was great but our server had no idea what bottle I was actually ordering. Overall our server just seemed to be going through the motions with no enthusiam which really brought down our celebratory evening.
I had to change the number of people in our party and your staff was extremely accomodating.
We enjoyed the food and also the singer at the lounge afterward. Plan on spending at least $100 for dinner for 2.
The food was amazing had there new brunch menue!!! Service was outstanding! Food was cooked to perfection!

I recently went to Mitchell's Fish Market with some co-workers and we had a wonderful dining experience. We all ordered the special, Brown Sugar Salmon, and it was fantastic. We all enjoyed the food and the service was great.
We had a great experience at Mitchell's. Our food was great and our server was bubbly and helpful. We will definately come again.
Excellent food! Everything was delicious, portions were big. Great service!

column4: 888 West Big Beaver Road, Suite 111 Troy, MI  48084
column13: We had a fantastic time at Moton's. Patrick gave us superb service and the food was incredible. While not a typical choice, we started with steamed crab legs for an appetizer. They were amazing. I love crab legs but don't usually order them because of the mess required to eat them. These came out sliced in two giving us access to the meat without any of the mess. The wet towels afterwards were a nice touch. The salads were the largest I have ever seen and tasted amazing. My fillet was done exactly the way I like it, and the shrimp alexander was a nice complement. Of the sides, my favorite was the cheesy a gratin potatoes. For dessert, we all had the legendary hot chocolate lava cake - awesome. If you haven’t tried it, this Morton's is a d

It's a treat for me to go to places like this as it's a bit beyond my price range. I went because I had a groupon. The service was terrific, very accomodating when we asked to move tables due to my dining companions not being happy with the volume of the guy at the next tables voice. My only complaint was that the beef wellington wasn't as spectacular as I thought it would be. It wasn't really a traditional preparation, not that there was really anything wrong with it.

Great salads at great prices for the quality. Coffee a bit costly as it doesn't stay warm (but tastes good). Service was great and very friendly but professional. Good place for smaller groups and for lunch. Have not tried dinner yet.

column4: 114 W. Liberty Street Ann Arbor, MI  48104
column13: Pacific Rim never disappoints. They are our favorite--including outside of Ann Arbor, Michigan, and the US!

The restaurant was packed full house at 7:30 on a Saturday night and when we arrived for our reservation we were seated immediately. The service was outstanding yet not overbearing. Our food was authentic Italian and as good as it can get. Whenever we visit family in Ann Arbor we always try to dine somewhere different and avoid the chains. I'm sure we will break the rule and return to Palio. Excellent!

column4: 300 S. Maple Road Ann Arbor, MI  48103
column13: Always consistent- food not amazing but good. Very nice atmosphere. They also take reservations which is great on a Michigan game day.Variety of food available is nice- salads, sandwiches and entrees.
Had a great time before the game and my wife loved it

column4: 207 South Main Street Ann Arbor, MI  48103
column13: Over all it was a great night out! If your looking for something different, there's not another restaurant in the area like The Ravens Club.

This is the best place for seafood in Ann Arbor. Entrees are reasonable still, $25-30. The menue is on a Motorola tablet which allows easy wine paring. The bread to start the meal is fantastic. Try the escargot but be careful not to burn yourself. The combo type platters are great. I got the Blue Plate Special (or something similar) and my date got a similar combination over rice. Between the two items I think we covered 80% of the menue.
Huge storm (Sandy) effects so outdoor activity was very limited, not your fault. Room (208) excellent. Broken window latch allowed one window to blow open a bit. Was reported at checkout.
Great food service needs improvemnt our server was not up to standard

Love how they come to the table and make the guacamole right at the table side. If you love fish tacos, good place to get them. Great food selection and good margaritas. This is the second time going and will definitely return.

column4: 17430 Hall Road Suite R102 Clinton Township, MI  48038
column13: Nice lunch...good mahi tacos...enjoyed it.

column4: 340 Town Center Blvd. White Lake, MI  48386
column13: This was our first visit but certainly not our last. The chef utilizes locally grown ingredients as much as possible to create a seasonal menu which is delicious and beautifully presented. There is a tasting menu offering several choices at a reasonable price. Vegetarian and gluten free choices are readily available. We also tried some of their creative alcoholic beverages and these too were a success. Our server, Karen, was knowledgeable, friendly, and patient with our many questions. It's the kind of place where you'd go for a bowl of soup and a salad, a hamburger, or a full course meal and know that everything will be delicious.
Can't go to michigan without dining at Rugby!!

column4: 755 West Big Beaver Road Suite 151 Troy, MI  48048
column13: Wonderful dining experience. Friendly, courteous service. Highly recommend.
The salmon was very tasty. A lot of choices on the regular menu and delicious daily specials
It was a great experience having a lunch meeting at your venue. I will drive 45 miles for that scene anytime.
Great food & great variety for vegetarians & meat eaters!

We went for sweetest day, and it was ok. The place is very small and their high table tops are uncomfortable to sit in. The food was excellent, but there were only 3 waiters in the establishment and we had to wait for everything. It took 20 min for us to cash out our bill. We missed our next planned event due to that. I would recommend it or lunch or a girls night, but not for a romantic evening...too small and noisy.

Excellent food, service, and ambiance. The tables are a bit limited in number, but very well worth the visit. With reservations, haven't had a wait. Have tried several items from the menu and all have been delicious.

The menu is very well thought out. The meals focus on taste and quality, not quantity. Great place for a flavorful dinner without being weighted down. Our server could have been a little more attentive and service a little faster. All and all a great dinning experience and I will go again.

We had a party of seven woman and the table was set up with us on each side facing each other. The people that took care of us offered to move us to a round table (much prefered) However, we decided not to bother. Looking back, it would've been easier to converse at a round table if there was room.Food and service were excellent.

I've been a fan of the original Lelli's since my childhood - it was always the restaurant our family chose to celebrate special occasions. Steven Lelli's Inn on the Green has beautifully captured the ambiance, service, and food from the Detroit location. I've been buying gift certificates to give to friends and family as treats, and have received consistent positive feedback from all the recipients. Our visit Saturday night - from the wine recommendation to the dessert service - reinforced my continued love of this place.

Went there for Sunday brunch with some friends and my 7-year-old daughter. The food was good, though the biscuits were cold and the foccacia bread was a little soggy. My daughter's chicken strips were actually really really good, much better than the usual pre-frozen stuff. The service was slow. Our server took forever to take our order and was slow to bring stuff out. We had to ask for more cream and he just wasn't on his game. I'd still go back but wouldn't rush there.

My friend and I split a Greek omelet and loved it. The ingredients were fresh and well seasoned. Our waitress was friendly, and aware of when we needed refills on coffee. I also loved the decor, very different. All and all, a great experience.
A little loud, but a good place to go for meeting friends and catching up. Great food and personable staff. I'll be going back.

I wanted a reservation at 7 and the restaurant told me only 6 and 8 were available. We took 6:00, and didn't leave until 8:30. There were many tables that remained unoccupied throughout the evening, we were very angry about that.

column4: Inside The Henry Hotel at~300 Town Center Drive Dearborn, MI  48126
column13: I would highly recommend this place. We had risotto that was slightly oversalted, but flavourful and rice was cooked al dente. The braised short ribs were excellent. Butternut squash ravioli were generally good, slightly overcooked. The wine list was impressive. Espresso and macchiato were good.One more comment: we are on the road secondary to Sandy. For the two out of the last three nights I booked restaurants based on the Open Table recommendations -and I was very happy overall. Tonight, we used a recommendation from a local person and were very disappointed.Thank you.

column4: 110 South Main Street Ann Arbor, MI  48104
column13: Have been there multiple times and always look forward to my next visit

We had dinner last Saturday night at Volares. Dinner was wonderful. I had the Filet without zip sauce (not a fan of zip on steaks). I believe steaks should stand on their won which this one really did. The wine list is well rounded and we had 2 bottles of wonderful Cabernet.
Wonderful first visit to this place!
Love this place! Beautiful house and friendly service. Food is made with special ingredients.

We had a table of 10 and were put at a table in the back, which was nice, since there was no one around us and we could carry on a conversation with the whole table. Food was very good, although service was a little slow. We were the last people there and they were cleaning around us and obviously wanted to close up, which would have been understandable if it were not 10:30 on a Friday night.
As always, the Roadhouse delivers a great experience. Still pricey, but the food is consistently good, the menu always has surprises, and the service is attentive.
